context_bundle.summary: Rust asynchronous programming with tokio runtime, async/await syntax, futures, and concurrent async patterns

onboarding.quick_start: cargo add tokio --features full && cargo add reqwest
common_patterns: Async function: 'async fn fetch_data() -> Result<String, reqwest::Error> { let response = reqwest::get("https://api.example.com").await?; response.text().await }'
Tokio runtime: '#[tokio::main] async fn main() { let result = fetch_data().await; }'
Spawn task: 'let handle = tokio::spawn(async { expensive_computation().await }); let result = handle.await.unwrap();'
Join: 'let (result1, result2) = tokio::join!(task1(), task2()); // concurrent execution'
Channels: 'let (tx, mut rx) = tokio::sync::mpsc::channel(100); tokio::spawn(async move { tx.send(42).await.unwrap(); }); let value = rx.recv().await;'
Mutex: 'let data = Arc::new(tokio::sync::Mutex::new(0)); let data_clone = data.clone(); tokio::spawn(async move { let mut lock = data_clone.lock().await; *lock += 1; });'
Stream: 'use tokio_stream::StreamExt; let mut stream = tokio_stream::iter(vec![1, 2, 3]); while let Some(value) = stream.next().await { println!("{}", value); }'
known_errors: cannot await in non-async function: Add 'async' keyword to function signature
task panicked: Add error handling in spawned tasks, use Result return type
deadlock: Check for circular dependencies in locks, use timeout
runtime not found: Add #[tokio::main] or create runtime manually
Send bound not satisfied: Ensure types are Send, avoid non-Send types across await points
future not polled: Ensure .await is called on futures
